revised_title: Theoretical and Experimental Aspects of Fullerene Electron Acceptance
tldr: This article discusses the unique properties of fullerenes, a new class of carbon-based molecules, which function as powerful electron acceptors. The authors review experimental evidence for electron addition to fullerenes and explain their extraordinary electron affinity through a combination of topology and rehybridization. They also explore the theoretical aspects of fullerene electronic structure and its implications for their redox chemistry.
